g.text: In summary, a series of high-quality Zn
NCs are synthesized using the ZnX
precursors contain the same halide, this paves a pathway for the inclusion of Zn
matrix. When the content of Zn
is increased from 0% to 15% in CsZn
the NCs retain the identical crystal structure and morphology except for the lattice contraction and the reduced
NCs dimension. The lattice contraction and the reduced unit cell dimension of the NCs resulted in an increased
bandgap and blue-shifted PL emission without much reduction in the PLQYs (
). Moreover, owing to their outstanding optical properties, the CsZn
potential for use in WLEDs as a color conversion layer. Experimentally, for the first time, the fourfold conversion
layers (blue, green, yellow, and red) of CsZn
NCs are used with UV LED chips to obtain white light
having superior quality that leads to a tunable color hue (2218–8335 K) with CRI maximized to 93, and high
LER in the range of 268–318 lm·W
. Based on these results, we expect that these NCs are feasible for obtaining
next-generation white light sources with remarkable optical properties and reduced environmental toxicity.
We used the hot-injection method with a slight modifica-
tion for the synthesis of CsZn
, 0.243 g) to oleic acid (OA, 0.75 mL), and octadecene (ODE,12 mL) into
50 mL flask. The mixture was dried under vacuum for approximately 1 h at 120 °C and then heated under N
had reacted with OA. Then, 0.188 mmol of PbX
(0.087 g)] or their mixtures (in desired ratio) and 0.188 mmol of ZnX
(0.060 g)] were taken into 25 mL flask with ODE (5 mL), OA (0.5 mL), and oleylamine (0.5 mL) sepa-
rately, and were dried using vacuum oven for 1 h at 120 °C. Note that the Trioctylphosphine (1 mL per 5 mL of
ODE) was added into the aforementioned mixture for the synthesis of chloride-based NCs. These mixtures were
stirred at 90 °C on a hot plate until the PbX
salts were completely dissolved. To the solution obtained
by mixing the proportionate amount of PbX
precursors, the Cs-oleate solution (0.4 mL, preheated to
100 °C before injection) was quickly injected into the mixture. This was followed by the immediate transference
of the mixture into the ice-water bath where the mixture was allowed to cool for a certain time (
cooling process results in the crude solution of the NCs that were subjected to centrifugation at 3500 rpm for
10 minutes. Then, the precipitated NCs were separated from the supernatant, thereby transferring the NCs in
toluene for storage. In addition, the composition of halides was attenuated on CsZn
Optical characterization of white light emission. (
) EL spectra of white light with a tunable CCT.
) CIE diagram showing CIE coordinates of white light with different CCT. (Inset is the photographs of the
devices at CCT: (i) 8335 K, (ii) 6316 K, and (iii) 2510 K of white light.)
Estimation of optical parameters of WLEDs. The table represents the measured value of CCT, CRI,
LER, and CIE coordinates of as-fabricated WLEDs.
